title: Quotient of a formal language
summary: In mathematics and computer science, the right quotient (or simply quotient) of a language L 1 {\displaystyle L_{1}} with respect to language L 2 {\displaystyle L_{2}} is the language consisting of strings w such that wx is in L 1 {\displaystyle L_{1}} for some string x in L 2 {\displaystyle L_{2}} .[1] Formally:
